properties.areaDesc: Waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR from 10 to 60 nm; Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued February 13 at 2:39PM PST until February 15 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Steep northwest seas 10 to 15 ft. Seas will initially be
composed of a mix of 3 to 6 foot 10 second northwest swell and
building longer 18 second period west-northwest swell through
Friday morning. Friday afternoon through Friday night northerly
wind waves will build as winds increase to 15 to 25 knots south
of Cape Blanco. Friday afternoon through Saturday morning
northwest swell will subside from 15 feet to 10 feet at 15
seconds.

* WHERE...All of the waters will experience steep seas hazardous
to small craft. Advisory level winds are only expected for areas
between 3 and 30 NM south of Cape Sebastian.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 10 AM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Building long period swell early Friday morning
through Friday afternoon is likely to increase the size of the
surf zone as more breakers occur. Use extra caution when
crossing bars, as they are likely to become especially
dangerous. Additionally, gusty winds and/or steep seas could
capsize or damage smaller vessels.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should remain in port and avoid the area of hazardous
conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM PST SATURDAY
